name: Pokémon abilities
effect:
Each ability from the latest generation of Pokémon games is listed below, along with a short
description and how many Pokémon can have that ability. Click an ability name to see the Pokémon
that can learn it.
 Abilities, introduced in Generation 3 (Ruby/Sapphire), are special attributes given to each Pokémon that can aid them in battle. Many abilities act as a power-up by increasing a move or stat; others introduce a third-party effect like a weather condition. Some abilities can even hinder a Pokémon battle.
 Each Pokémon can have only one ability, however, some have the option of two different abilities. The choice is random and each ability is equally likely. There are 308 single-ability Pokémon and 355 dual-ability Pokémon.
 In Pokémon Black & White, a third hidden ability was introduced. The third ability is only available when a Pokémon is returned from the Dream World, a new online feature that is part of the Pokémon Global Link. 568 Pokémon have a Dream World ability.
 A selection of related questions from PokéBase:

name: Emergency Exit (ability)
effect:
Switches out when HP falls below 50%.
 No Pokémon have Emergency Exit as a hidden ability.

name: Electric Surge (ability)
effect: Electric Surge creates a low-lying electric field, like the move Electric Terrain, when the Pokémon enters battle. It prevents grounded Pokémon from falling asleep, and increases the power of Electric type attacks.

name: Effect Spore (ability)
effect: Contact may poison or cause paralysis or sleep.

name: Early Bird (ability)
effect: The Pokémon awakens quickly from sleep.

name: Dry Skin (ability)
effect: Dry Skin causes several effects:

name: Drought (ability)
effect: Drought creates harsh sunlight when the ability-bearer enters battle. The effect lasts 5 turns, unless it is cleared via Air Lock or Cloud Nine or replaced by another weather condition. If multiple Pokémon with weather-generating abilities (Drought, Drizzle, Sand Stream or Snow Warning) enter the field on the same turn, each weather condition will activate consecutively, fastest Pokémon first. In other words, the resultant weather condition will be that of the slowest Pokémon. Prior to Generation 6, Drought lasts indefinitely upon activation.

name: Drizzle (ability)
effect: Drizzle creates a rain shower when the ability-bearer enters battle. The effect lasts 5 turns, unless it is cleared via Air Lock or Cloud Nine or replaced by another weather condition. If multiple Pokémon with weather-generating abilities (Drizzle, Drought, Sand Stream or Snow Warning) enter the field on the same turn, each weather condition will activate consecutively, fastest Pokémon first. In other words, the resultant weather condition will be that of the slowest Pokémon. Prior to Generation 6, Drizzle lasts indefinitely upon activation.

name: Dragon's Maw (ability)
effect:
Signature ability of Regidrago. Powers up Dragon-type moves.
 No Pokémon have Dragon's Maw as a hidden ability.

name: Download (ability)
effect: Download raises either the bearer's Attack or Special Attack by one stage when switching into battle, base on the opponent's defenses. It raises Attack if the opponent's Defense is lower than its Special Defense, or raises Special Attack if opponent's Special Defense is lower than or equal to its Defense. In double and triple battles, Download compares the sum of all opponents' Defense stats and the sum of all opponents' Special Defense stats and uses the lowest total. No Pokémon have Download as a hidden ability.

name: Disguise (ability)
effect: Disguise allows the bearer to avoid damage for one attack, in a similar way to Substitute. No Pokémon have Disguise as a hidden ability.

name: Desolate Land (ability)
effect: Desolate Land creates extremely harsh sunlight when the ability is activated (by Groudon reverting to its Primal form). Extremely harsh sunlight has the same effects as harsh sunlight but with some additions: The abilities Cloud Nine or Air Lock are still able to bypass the effects of Desolate Land, but Mold Breaker is not. No Pokémon have Desolate Land as a hidden ability.

name: Delta Stream (ability)
effect: Delta Stream creates strong winds when the ability is activated (by Rayquaza Mega-Evolving). Strong winds have the following effects: The abilities Cloud Nine or Air Lock are still able to bypass the effects of Delta Stream, but Mold Breaker is not. No Pokémon have Delta Stream as a hidden ability.

name: Defiant (ability)
effect: Defiant raises the ability-bearer's Attack by two stages when hit by a stat-lowering move. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

name: Defeatist (ability)
effect: When the HP of a Pokémon with Defeatist falls below 50%, its Attack and Special Attack stats are halved. No Pokémon have Defeatist as a hidden ability.

name: Dazzling (ability)
effect: Dazzling makes the Pokémon immune to high-priority moves (i.e. those with a priority above 0). No Pokémon have Dazzling as a hidden ability.

name: Zen Mode (ability)
effect: Zen Mode changes the ability-bearer's form to Zen Mode when their health falls below 50%. Currently it only applies to Darmanitan, whose form change makes it Fire/Psychic type and changes its stats around. No Pokémon have the ability Zen Mode as a regular ability.

name: Wonder Skin (ability)
effect: Wonder Skin halves the accuracy of all status moves targeted at the ability-bearer. It does not affect self-inflicted status moves like Reflect or Swords Dance, nor does it affect the secondary conditions of attacking moves like Flamethrower.

name: Wonder Guard (ability)
effect: Wonder Guard prevents damage from direct attacks unless they are super-effective. Shedinja is the only Pokémon to have this ability so this means that only Fire, Flying, Rock, Ghost and Dark moves will have an effect. However, Pokémon protected by Wonder Guard are not immune to indirect attacks. Status-category moves still work and all end-of-turn damage will still incur, for example from poisoning, burns, sandstorms or hail. Entry hazards such as Spikes or Stealth Rock will also damage Pokémon with Wonder Guard switching in. Attacks that do not take their type in account will also hit, such as Struggle, Beat Up or Future Sight. Since Shedinja only has 1 HP, any of the above damage will result in an instant knockout. No Pokémon have Wonder Guard as a hidden ability.

name: Wimp Out (ability)
effect: Wimp Out causes the bearer to switch out (or flee in a wild battle) when its HP falls below 50%. No Pokémon have Wimp Out as a hidden ability.

name: White Smoke (ability)
effect:
Prevents other Pokémon from lowering its stats.
 If a Pokémon with White Smoke is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are only half as likely to appear.

name: Weak Armor (ability)
effect: When a Pokémon with Weak Armor is hit by a physical move, its Defense drops one stage, but its Speed increases by one stage. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each, or lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

name: Water Veil (ability)
effect: Prevents the Pokémon from getting a burn.

name: Water Compaction (ability)
effect: Water Compaction raises the bearer's Defense by 2 stages when it is hit by a Water-type move. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. No Pokémon have Water Compaction as a hidden ability.

name: Water Bubble (ability)
effect: Water Bubble reduces damage taken from Fire-type moves by 50%, and doubles the power of Water-type moves used by the ability-bearer. It also prevents the Pokémon from being burned. No Pokémon have Water Bubble as a hidden ability.

name: Water Absorb (ability)
effect: A Pokémon with Water Absorb heals 1⁄4 of its maximum HP when hit by a Water-type attack.

name: Wandering Spirit (ability)
effect:
Swaps abilities with opponents on contact.
 No Pokémon have Wandering Spirit as a hidden ability.

name: Volt Absorb (ability)
effect: A Pokémon with Volt Absorb heals 1⁄4 of its maximum HP when hit by an Electric-type attack, including Thunder Wave. In Generation 3, Volt Absorb does not activate for Thunder Wave.

name: Vital Spirit (ability)
effect: Vital Spirit prevents the ability-bearer from falling asleep. This means that it also prevents the use of the move Rest. If a Pokémon with Vital Spirit is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are 50% more likely to be higher level.

name: Victory Star (ability)
effect:
Boosts the accuracy of its allies and itself.
 No Pokémon have Victory Star as a hidden ability.

name: Unseen Fist (ability)
effect:
Contact moves can strike through Protect/Detect.
 No Pokémon have Unseen Fist as a hidden ability.

name: Unnerve (ability)
effect: Makes the foe nervous and unable to eat Berries.

name: Unburden (ability)
effect: Raises Speed if a held item is used.

name: Unaware (ability)
effect: Ignores any stat changes in the Pokémon.

name: Turboblaze (ability)
effect: Turboblaze prevents a target's ability from affecting moves that the Turboblaze Pokémon uses. It only affects abilities that change the power, accuracy or other effects of moves. For example, Reshiram would be able to hit Bronzong (having Levitate) using a Ground-type move like Earth Power. Ground type moves would still not affect Flying types. However, using Dragon Claw against a Pokémon with Aftermath would still receive HP loss as Aftermath did not affect the Dragon Claw attack itself. No Pokémon have Turboblaze as a hidden ability.

name: Truant (ability)
effect: Truant causes the ability-bearer to only attack every alternate turn. On the even turns, it will say the Pokémon is loafing around. If a Pokémon with Truant uses a move that requires recharging on the second turn (such as Hyper Beam), it will recharge on the same turn the Pokémon loafs around. Moves where the user prepares on the first turn and attacks on the second (such as Solarbeam or Fly) cannot be used. The moves Worry Seed, Entrainment and Simple Beam do not work on Pokémon with Truant. Truant can technically be Skill Swapped away, however neither Slakoth, Slaking or Durant learn it.

name: Triage (ability)
effect: Triage increases the priority of HP-restoring moves to +3, when used by the ability-bearer. Note: as Comfey is currently the only Pokémon with this ability, the only moves affected in practice are Draining Kiss, Floral Healing, Rest, and Synthesis. No Pokémon have Triage as a hidden ability.

name: Transistor (ability)
effect:
Signature ability of Regieleki. Powers up Electric-type moves.
 No Pokémon have Transistor as a hidden ability.

name: Trace (ability)
effect:
The Pokémon copies a foe's Ability.
 No Pokémon have Trace as a hidden ability.

name: Toxic Boost (ability)
effect:
Powers up physical attacks when poisoned.
 No Pokémon have the ability Toxic Boost as a regular ability.

name: Tough Claws (ability)
effect: Tough Claws increases the power of moves that make contact. Most Physical-category moves are contact moves. No Pokémon have Tough Claws as a hidden ability.

name: Torrent (ability)
effect: Torrent increases the power of Water-type moves by 50% (1.5×) when the ability-bearer's HP falls below a third of its maximum (known in-game as in a pinch).

name: Tinted Lens (ability)
effect: Powers up “not very effective” moves.

name: Thick Fat (ability)
effect: Thick Fat reduces the damage taken from Fire-type and Ice-type moves by 50%. Interestingly, many Pokémon possessing this ability already take reduced damage from those types. A Dewgong or Walrein with Thick Fat would take 1⁄8 normal damage when hit by an Ice-type move.

name: Teravolt (ability)
effect: Teravolt prevents a target's ability from affecting moves that the Teravolt Pokémon uses. It only affects abilities that change the power, accuracy or other effects of moves. For example, Zekrom would be able to hit Bronzong (having Levitate) using a Ground-type move like Earth Power. Ground type moves would still not affect Flying types. However, using Dragon Claw against a Pokémon with Aftermath would still receive HP loss as Aftermath did not affect the Dragon Claw attack itself. No Pokémon have Teravolt as a hidden ability.

name: Telepathy (ability)
effect: Pokémon with the Telepathy ability will not take damage from teammates in double and triple battles. This affects moves such as Surf and Earthquake, which normally hit all Pokémon on the field apart from the user.

name: Technician (ability)
effect: Technician increases the power of moves - that are usually base power 60 or below - by 50%. Moves with variable base power are boosted only when it is 60 or below. For example, if Magnitude hits at level 6 it will be boosted from 50 to 75, but level 7 will stay at 70 base power. Moves like Sonic Boom that deal fixed HP damage are not affected by Technician.

name: Tangling Hair (ability)
effect:
Contact with the Pokémon lowers the attacker's Speed stat.
 No Pokémon have Tangling Hair as a hidden ability.

name: Tangled Feet (ability)
effect: Raises evasion if the Pokémon is confused.

name: Synchronize (ability)
effect: If the opponent causes a burn, paralysis, or poisoning of a Pokémon with Synchronize, the opponent receives the status condition too. Self-inflicted status conditions (for example through the use of an item) are not passed on. In Generations 3-4, bad poison is only passed on as regular poison. If a Pokémon with Synchronize is the leading party Pokémon, there is a 50% chance of each wild Pokémon encountered having the same nature. No Pokémon have Synchronize as a hidden ability.

name: Symbiosis (ability)
effect:
The Pokémon can pass an item to an ally.
 No Pokémon have the ability Symbiosis as a regular ability.

name: Swift Swim (ability)
effect: Swift Swim doubles the ability-bearer's Speed during rain.

name: Sweet Veil (ability)
effect: Sweet Veil prevents this Pokémon and its allies from falling asleep, for example from moves like Hypnosis.

name: Swarm (ability)
effect: Swarm increases the power of Bug-type moves by 50% (1.5×) when the ability-bearer's HP falls below a third of its maximum (known in-game as in a pinch). If a Pokémon with Swarm is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are twice as likely to appear.

name: Surge Surfer (ability)
effect: Surge Surfer doubles the bearer's Speed when Electric Terrain is active. No Pokémon have Surge Surfer as a hidden ability.

name: Super Luck (ability)
effect: Super Luck raises the ability-bearer's critical-hit ratio by one stage (for most moves this increases from a 1⁄16 chance to 1⁄8).

name: Suction Cups (ability)
effect: Suction Cups prevents opponents forcing the ability-bearer to switch out or flee via the moves Roar, Whirlwind, Circle Throw, or Dragon Tail, or the item Red Card. If a Pokémon with Suction Cups is the leading party Pokémon, the chance of hooking a Pokémon during fishing increases. No Pokémon have Suction Cups as a hidden ability.

name: Sturdy (ability)
effect: Sturdy allows the Pokémon to survive with 1 HP if attacked at full HP with an attack that would otherwise knock it out. It also prevents One-Hit-KO moves (Fissure, Horn Drill, Guillotine or Sheer Cold). If Sturdy activates before the final hit of a multi-hit move (such as Fury Swipes), the subsequent hit will still deal damage and therefore cause the Pokémon to faint. Sturdy does not prevent self-inflicted KO moves such as Selfdestruct, Explosion and Final Gambit.

name: Strong Jaw (ability)
effect: Strong Jaw increases the power of all biting moves by 50%. The attacks classed as biting moves are shown below with their normal and boosted power: No Pokémon have Strong Jaw as a hidden ability.

name: Storm Drain (ability)
effect: Storm Drain forces all single-target Water-type moves - used by any other Pokémon on the field - to target this Pokémon, and with 100% accuracy. The ability is most useful in double/triple battles. When hit by the move, it deals no damage to the ability-bearer but raises its Special Attack by one stage. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. Storm Drain will activate for an Water-type Hidden Power, but not Water-type Judgment. The ability is overridden by other Pokémon becoming the center of attention from the moves Follow Me or Rage Powder. In Generation 4, Storm Drain did not increase Special Attack nor give immunity to Water-type attacks. It also did not activate for Hidden Power.

name: Sticky Hold (ability)
effect: Sticky Hold prevents held items from being taken or switched. If a Pokémon with Sticky Hold is the leading party Pokémon, the chance of hooking a Pokémon during fishing increases. No Pokémon have Sticky Hold as a hidden ability.

name: Stench (ability)
effect: A Pokémon with Stench has a 10% chance of causing the opponent to flinch when hit by a damaging move (provided the ability-bearer strikes first as usual). Stench does not stack with the items King's Rock or Razor Fang, so an ability-bearer holding either item will keep the flinch chance at 10%. In Generations 3-4, Stench has no effect in battle. If a Pokémon with Stench is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are only half as likely to appear.

name: Steely Spirit (ability)
effect:
Powers up ally Pokémon's Steel-type moves.
 No Pokémon have the ability Steely Spirit as a regular ability.

name: Steelworker (ability)
effect: Steelworker increases the power of Steel-type moves by 50%. No Pokémon have Steelworker as a hidden ability.

name: Steam Engine (ability)
effect: Steam Engine raises the user's Speed by three stages when it is hit by a Fire- or Water-type attack. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. No Pokémon have Steam Engine as a hidden ability.

name: Steadfast (ability)
effect: Raises Speed each time the Pokémon flinches.

name: Static (ability)
effect: If a Pokémon with Static is hit by a move making contact, there is a 30% chance the foe will become paralyzed. If a Pokémon with Static is the leading party Pokémon, it is 50% more likely that a wild Pokémon encountered will be Electric type.

name: Stance Change (ability)
effect: Stance Change is exclusive to Aegislash. When using a damage-dealing move, Aegislash switches to its Blade Forme. When using the move King's Shield, Aegislash switches to its Shield Forme. The form change occurs when the appropriate move is selected, regardless of whether the attack goes ahead (e.g. prevented by paralysis). No Pokémon have Stance Change as a hidden ability.

name: Stamina (ability)
effect: Stamina raises the bearer's Defense by one stage when it is attacked by any move. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. No Pokémon have Stamina as a hidden ability.

name: Stalwart (ability)
effect:
Ignores moves and abilities that draw in moves.
 No Pokémon have the ability Stalwart as a regular ability.

name: Stall (ability)
effect:
The Pokémon moves after all other Pokémon do.
 No Pokémon have Stall as a hidden ability.

name: Stakeout (ability)
effect: Stakeout enables the Pokémon to deal twice the normal damage to any Pokémon that switches in or enters the field mid-battle.

name: Speed Boost (ability)
effect: Its Speed stat is gradually boosted.

name: Soundproof (ability)
effect: Soundproof grants the Pokémon immunity to all sound-based moves, preventing all damage and effects. In Generation 5 only, Pokémon with Soundproof could be cured of status conditions by Heal Bell.

name: Soul-Heart (ability)
effect: Soul-Heart raises the bearer's Special Attack one stage when a teammate faints. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. No Pokémon have Soul-Heart as a hidden ability.

name: Solid Rock (ability)
effect: Solid Rock reduces the damage taken from super-effective attacks by 25%. For example, a Water-type move used against a Rock-type Pokémon with Solid Rock would deal 1.5× the usual damage instead of 2×. A double weakness would be reduced from 4× to 3×. No Pokémon have Solid Rock as a hidden ability.

name: Solar Power (ability)
effect: During harsh sunlight, Solar Power raises the ability-bearer's Special Attack by 50%, but it also loses 1⁄8 of its maximum HP after each turn.

name: Snow Warning (ability)
effect: Snow Warning creates a hailstorm when the ability-bearer enters battle. The effect lasts 5 turns, unless it is cleared via Air Lock or Cloud Nine or replaced by another weather condition. If multiple Pokémon with weather-generating abilities (Snow Warning, Drizzle, Drought or Sand Stream) enter the field on the same turn, each weather condition will activate consecutively, fastest Pokémon first. In other words, the resultant weather condition will be that of the slowest Pokémon. Prior to Generation 6, Snow Warning lasts indefinitely upon activation.

name: Snow Cloak (ability)
effect: Snow Cloak raises ability-bearer's evasion by 20% in a hail storm. It also gives immunity to damage by hail (if they are not already protected by being Ice type). If a Pokémon with Snow Cloak is the leading party Pokémon while travelling in a hail storm/blizzard, wild Pokémon are only half as likely to appear.

name: Sniper (ability)
effect: Sniper increases the power of critical hits by 1.5×. This means a critical hit will deal 2.25× normal damage instead of 1.5×. In Generations 1-5 critical hits deal 2× normal damage, so Sniper inflicts 3× normal damage.

name: Slush Rush (ability)
effect: Boosts the Pokémon's Speed stat in a hailstorm.

name: Slow Start (ability)
effect:
Temporarily halves Attack and Speed.
 No Pokémon have Slow Start as a hidden ability.

name: Skill Link (ability)
effect: Skill Link causes multi-strike moves to always hit their maximum number of times. The moves affected are listed below; note that moves such as Double Kick that always strike the same number of times are not affected. In Generation 4, Triple Kick is not affected by Skill Link.

name: Simple (ability)
effect: The Simple ability doubles the number of stages of all stat changes. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each, or lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. For example, using Swords Dance would increase the Pokémon's attack by 4 stages instead of the usual 2. If Tail Whip was targeted at a Pokémon with Simple, its Defense would drop 2 stages instead of 1. The move Simple Beam can change a Pokémon's ability to Simple. In Generation 4, Simple doubles the effects of stat changes but does not increase the actual number of stages. Stat increases are capped at the same multiplier of ×4, as per the table below. However, the resulting effect is exactly the same as current games.

name: Shields Down (ability)
effect: Shields Down causes the Pokémon to changes its appearance and stats depending on its remaining HP. When the Pokémon's HP is over 50%, it has higher defenses and is immune to status conditions. When its HP falls below 50%, the outer shell breaks and the Pokémon has higher attack. No Pokémon have Shields Down as a hidden ability.

name: Shield Dust (ability)
effect:
Blocks the added effects of attacks taken.
 No Pokémon have Shield Dust as a hidden ability.

name: Shell Armor (ability)
effect: Shell Armor prevents the Pokémon from receiving a critical hit.

name: Sheer Force (ability)
effect: Sheer Force increases the power of moves that have beneficial secondary effects by 30%, but removes those additional effects. Beneficial effects are defined as those that are positive for the user, such as: Non-beneficial effects, that Sheer Force will not activate for, include: If the user is holding a Life Orb and uses an attack that activates Sheer Force, it will not receive the 10% damage from Life Orb, but it gets boosts from both Life Orb and Sheer Force (total of 69% base power increase). Flamethrower normally has a 10% chance to burn the opponent. With Sheer Force, Flamethrower's base power is boosted from 95 to 124, but it will never cause a burn. Note that if a move has an advantageous and disadvantageous side-effect, Sheer Force still boosts the move but only the advantageous effect is removed. For example, Flare Blitz may cause a burn but also has recoil damage. A Pokémon with Sheer Force using the move would gain the power increase and still receive recoil damage, but it would never cause a burn. Here are the moves that increase in power under Sheer Force, listed alphabetically:

name: Shed Skin (ability)
effect:
The Pokémon may heal its own status problems.
 No Pokémon have Shed Skin as a hidden ability.

name: Shadow Tag (ability)
effect: Prevents the foe from escaping.

name: Shadow Shield (ability)
effect:
Reduces damage when HP is full.
 No Pokémon have Shadow Shield as a hidden ability.

name: Serene Grace (ability)
effect: Serene Grace doubles the chance of moves' secondary effects occurring - specifically stat changes, status ailments, or flinching. It also increases the chance of flinching due to the held items King's Rock and Razor Fang from 10% to 20% (however, note that those items do not affect moves that already have a flinch chance). Serene Grace does not affect status moves or the Pokémon's critical hit ratio. Shadow Ball normally has a 20% chance of lowering Special Defense; with Serene Grace it is boosted to a 40% chance. Air Slash has a 30% of causing the target to flinch; with Serene Grace it is boosted to a 60% chance. If the item King's Rock is held it does not increase that percentage, but rather if the move does not cause flinching (40% chance), then there is now a further 20% chance the target will flinch from King's Rock. This means Serene Grace with Air Slash and King's Rock gives a total probability of 68% (1 - 0.4*0.8) that the opponent will flinch. In Generations 3-4 Serene Grace does not increase the flinch chance of King's Rock or Razor Fang. In Generations 3-5 Serene Grace does not affect the move Secret Power.

name: Screen Cleaner (ability)
effect:
Nullifies effects of Light Screen, Reflect, and Aurora Veil.
 No Pokémon have Screen Cleaner as a hidden ability.

name: Scrappy (ability)
effect: Enables moves to hit Ghost-type Pokémon.

name: Schooling (ability)
effect: Schooling changes Wishiwashi into its School Form, if its HP is above 25% and Wishiwashi is at least level 20. If its HP falls below 25%, Wishiwashi will revert back to Solo Form. Schooling cannot be removed or replaced via moves like Skill Swap or the Mummy ability. No Pokémon have Schooling as a hidden ability.

name: Sap Sipper (ability)
effect: Boosts Attack when hit by a Grass-type move.

name: Sand Veil (ability)
effect: Sand Veil raises the ability-bearer's evasion by 20% in a sandstorm. It also gives immunity to sandstorm damage (if they are not already protected by being Ground/Rock/Steel type). If a Pokémon with Sand Veil is the leading party Pokémon while travelling in a sandstorm, wild Pokémon are only half as likely to appear.

name: Sand Stream (ability)
effect: Sand Stream creates a sandstorm when the ability-bearer enters battle. The effect lasts 5 turns, unless it is cleared via Air Lock or Cloud Nine or replaced by another weather condition. If multiple Pokémon with weather-generating abilities (Sand Stream, Drizzle, Drought or Snow Warning) enter the field on the same turn, each weather condition will activate consecutively, fastest Pokémon first. In other words, the resultant weather condition will be that of the slowest Pokémon. Prior to Generation 6, Sand Stream lasts indefinitely upon activation. No Pokémon have Sand Stream as a hidden ability.

name: Sand Spit (ability)
effect:
Creates a sandstorm when hit by an attack.
 No Pokémon have Sand Spit as a hidden ability.

name: Sand Rush (ability)
effect: Sand Rush doubles the ability-bearer's Speed during a sandstorm.

name: Sand Force (ability)
effect: Sand Force raises the power of Ground, Rock and Steel type moves by 30% during a sandstorm. It also grants immunity to the sandstorm damage, if not already immune (currently this only applies to Shellos since all other Pokémon with the ability are already immune).

name: Run Away (ability)
effect: Run Away allows the bearer to flee a battle with a wild Pokémon without fail, even if the opposing Pokémon has used a move like Mean Look or Bind, or has an ability such as Arena Trap. Pokémon with Run Away cannot switch out for another Pokémon, only flee. It does not allow the Pokémon to flee from Trainer battles.

name: Rough Skin (ability)
effect: When a Pokémon with Rough Skin is hit by a move that makes contact, the attacker receives damage equal to 1⁄8 of their maximum HP. Multi-hit moves (e.g. DoubleSlap) activate Rough Skin for each strike. In Generation 3, the damage from Rough Skin is 1⁄16 of the maximum HP.

name: Rock Head (ability)
effect: Protects the Pokémon from recoil damage.

name: RKS System (ability)
effect:
Changes type depending on held item.
 No Pokémon have RKS System as a hidden ability.

name: Rivalry (ability)
effect: Deals more damage to a Pokémon of same gender.

name: Ripen (ability)
effect:
Doubles the effect of berries.
 No Pokémon have Ripen as a hidden ability.

name: Regenerator (ability)
effect: A Pokémon with Regenerator restores 1⁄3 of its maximum HP when switching out.

name: Refrigerate (ability)
effect: Refrigerate causes all Normal-type attacking moves used by the Pokémon to become Ice-type, and increase in power by 20%. Ice-type Pokémon also gain STAB from those moves (which means an effective increase of 80%). In Generation 6, Refrigerate increases affected moves' power by 30%. No Pokémon have Refrigerate as a hidden ability.

name: Reckless (ability)
effect: Reckless increases the power of recoil moves by 20%. By extension this means the amount of recoil damage taken will increase as more more damage is dealt (except for High Jump Kick and Jump Kick which have fixed recoil). The attacks classed as punching moves are shown below with their normal and boosted power: * No Pokémon with Reckless can learn these moves.

name: Receiver (ability)
effect: A Pokémon with Receiver will inherit the ability of a teammate in a double/triple battle when that teammate faints. Abilities that activate upon entering the field, such as Intimidate, will activate when the Pokémon with Receiver inherits it. No Pokémon have Receiver as a hidden ability.

name: Rattled (ability)
effect: When a Pokémon with Rattled is hit by a Bug, Ghost or Dark type move, its Speed is raised one stage (up to the usual maximum of +6 stages).

name: Rain Dish (ability)
effect: A Pokémon with Rain Dish will recover 1⁄16 of its maximum HP during rain, after each turn.

name: Quick Feet (ability)
effect: Quick Feet raises the ability-bearer's Speed by 50% when inflicted by a major status ailment (poison, burn, paralysis, freeze or sleep). If paralyzed, the Pokémon does not suffer the usual drop in Speed. All other effects of the status condition remain, e.g. losing HP each turn (poison, burn), or being unable to attack (paralysis, freeze, sleep). If a Pokémon with Quick Feet is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are only half as likely to appear.

name: Quick Draw (ability)
effect: No Pokémon have Quick Draw as a hidden ability.

name: Queenly Majesty (ability)
effect:
Prevents use of priority moves.
 No Pokémon have Queenly Majesty as a hidden ability.

name: Pure Power (ability)
effect:
Raises the Pokémon's Attack stat.
 No Pokémon have Pure Power as a hidden ability.

name: Punk Rock (ability)
effect:
Boosts sound-based moves and halves damage from the same moves.
 No Pokémon have Punk Rock as a hidden ability.

name: Psychic Surge (ability)
effect: Psychic Surge creates a low-lying psychic field, like the move Psychic Terrain, when the Pokémon enters battle. It prevents high-priority moves being used and increases the power of Psychic type attacks.

name: Protean (ability)
effect: Protean changes the Pokémon's type to that of its previously used attack. No Pokémon have the ability Protean as a regular ability.

name: Propeller Tail (ability)
effect:
Ignores moves and abilities that draw in moves.
 No Pokémon have the ability Propeller Tail as a regular ability.

name: Prism Armor (ability)
effect: Prism Armor reduces the damage taken from super-effective attacks by 25%. It is not affected by the abilities Mold Breaker, Teravolt, or Turboblaze. For example, a Dark-type move used against a Psychic-type Pokémon with Prism Armor would deal 1.5× the usual damage instead of 2×. A double weakness would be reduced from 4× to 3×. No Pokémon have Prism Armor as a hidden ability.

name: Primordial Sea (ability)
effect: Primordial Sea creates heavy rain when the ability is activated (by Kyogre reverting to its Primal form). Heavy rain has the same effects as regular rain but with some additions: The abilities Cloud Nine or Air Lock are still able to bypass the effects of Primordial Sea, but Mold Breaker is not. No Pokémon have Primordial Sea as a hidden ability.

name: Pressure (ability)
effect: Pressure makes any attack targeted at the ability-bearer - regardless of whether it hits - use 2 PP instead of 1. If a Pokémon with Pressure is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are 50% more likely to be higher level.

name: Prankster (ability)
effect: Prankster increases the priority of status moves by +1. This means that a slower Pokémon with Prankster can use a status move before the opponent uses a regular move. Or if the ability-bearer is faster, it could use a status move before the opponent uses a priority move like Aqua Jet. The move Quick Guard does not block moves whose priority is increased by Prankster (but it does block moves that already have increased priority).

name: Power Spot (ability)
effect:
Just being next to the Pokémon powers up moves.
 No Pokémon have Power Spot as a hidden ability.

name: Power of Alchemy (ability)
effect:
The Pokémon copies the Ability of a defeated ally.
 No Pokémon have the ability Power of Alchemy as a regular ability.

name: Power Construct (ability)
effect: Power Construct is unique to Zygarde. When Zygarde 10% Forme or Zygarde 50% Forme falls below half HP, it changes into Zygarde Complete Forme. As Complete Forme has a higher base HP than the other two Formes, its HP is also restored by the same amount the maximum HP increased. No Pokémon have Power Construct as a hidden ability.

name: Poison Touch (ability)
effect: May poison targets when a Pokémon makes contact.

name: Poison Point (ability)
effect:
Contact with the Pokémon may poison the attacker.
 No Pokémon have Poison Point as a hidden ability.

name: Poison Heal (ability)
effect: Restores HP if the Pokémon is poisoned.

name: Plus (ability)
effect: Ups Sp. Atk if another Pokémon has Plus or Minus.

name: Pixilate (ability)
effect: Pixilate causes all Normal-type attacking moves used by the Pokémon to become Fairy-type, and increase in power by 20%. Fairy-type Pokémon also gain STAB from those moves (which means an effective increase of 80%). In Generation 6, Pixilate increases affected moves' power by 30%.

name: Pickup (ability)
effect: When another Pokémon on the field uses a single-use held item, a Pokémon with Pickup will obtain the used item (if they are not already holding anything) and it can be used again. Pokémon with Pickup will also obtain an item thrown at them with Fling (if they are not already holding anything). In Generations 3-4, Pickup has no effect in battle. When a battle ends, any party Pokémon with Pickup has a 10% chance of picking up an item (if they are not already holding an item). Items picked up range from Potions, Great Balls, Ultra Balls and Rare Candies up to Leftovers and some TMs. Better items have a lower chance of being found; furthermore, higher-level Pokémon will obtain better items.

name: Pickpocket (ability)
effect:
Steals an item when hit by another Pokémon.
 No Pokémon have the ability Pickpocket as a regular ability.

name: Perish Body (ability)
effect:
When hit by a move that makes direct contact, the Pokémon and the attacker will faint after three turns unless they switch out of battle.
 No Pokémon have the ability Perish Body as a regular ability.

name: Pastel Veil (ability)
effect: Pastel Veil prevents the Pokémon and its teammates from being poisoned. It also cures teammates of poisoning when it enters the battlefield. No Pokémon have Pastel Veil as a hidden ability.

name: Parental Bond (ability)
effect: Parental Bond allows the ability-bearer to attack twice. The second attack hits with 25% of the power, so in effect it is equivalent to a 25% boost to all attacks. Parental Bond is the signature ability of Mega Kangaskhan. When the ability is in use, the mother and child each attack. In Generation 6, the second attack of Parental Bond hits with 50% power of the first. No Pokémon have Parental Bond as a hidden ability.

name: Own Tempo (ability)
effect: Prevents the Pokémon from becoming confused.

name: Overgrow (ability)
effect: Overgrow increases the power of Grass-type moves by 50% (1.5×) when the ability-bearer's HP falls below a third of its maximum (known in-game as in a pinch).

name: Overcoat (ability)
effect: Overcoat makes the Pokémon immune to residual damage from weather conditions (specifically Hail and Sandstorm).

name: Oblivious (ability)
effect: Oblivious makes the Pokémon immune to gender-based moves and abilities, specifically Attract, Captivate and Cute Charm.

name: Normalize (ability)
effect: Normalize causes all moves used by the Pokémon to become Normal-type, and attacking moves increase in power by 20%. Normal-type Pokémon also gain STAB from those moves (which means an effective increase of 80%). The following moves are not affected by Normalize: Hidden Power, Judgment, Multi-Attack, Natural Gift, Revelation Dance, Struggle, Techno Blast, Weather Ball, and damaging Z-Moves. The move Flying Press deals Normal/Flying type damage instead of Fighting/Flying. Freeze-Dry remains super-effective against Water-types, but follows the Normal type chart against other types (e.g. neutral against Grass-types). In Generations 4-6, Normalize did not increase damage (besides any usual boosts like STAB). All moves listed above except Struggle are affected by Normalize. No Pokémon have Normalize as a hidden ability.

name: No Guard (ability)
effect: No Guard ensures that all attacks used by, and targeted at, the ability-bearer hit without fail. This includes moves used on a Pokémon in the hidden stages of the moves Fly, Dive, Dig and Shadow Force. If a Pokémon with No Guard is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are twice as likely to appear.

name: Neutralizing Gas (ability)
effect:
Neutralizes abilities of all Pokémon in battle.
 No Pokémon have Neutralizing Gas as a hidden ability.

name: Neuroforce (ability)
effect:
Powers up moves that are super effective.
 No Pokémon have Neuroforce as a hidden ability.

name: Natural Cure (ability)
effect: All status problems heal when it switches out.

name: Mummy (ability)
effect:
Contact with this Pokémon spreads this Ability.
 No Pokémon have Mummy as a hidden ability.

name: Multitype (ability)
effect: Multitype changes the ability-bearer's type if it is holding one of the Type Plate items. Moves of the corresponding type receive STAB. The moves Gastro Acid, Role Play, Skill Swap, Worry Seed or the ability Trace do not affect a Pokémon with Multitype. The moves Covet, Knock Off, Switcheroo and Thief cannot remove Plates from a Pokémon with Multitype, but they can remove any other item. The Plates are: In Generation 4 the moves Covet, Knock Off, Switcheroo and Thief (all of which remove items) do not affect Pokémon with Multitype. No Pokémon have Multitype as a hidden ability.

name: Multiscale (ability)
effect:
Reduces damage when HP is full.
 No Pokémon have the ability Multiscale as a regular ability.

name: Moxie (ability)
effect: Moxie increases the user's Attack one stage upon fainting an opponent. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

name: Motor Drive (ability)
effect: Raises Speed if hit by an Electric-type move.

name: Moody (ability)
effect:
Raises one stat and lowers another.
 No Pokémon have the ability Moody as a regular ability.

name: Mold Breaker (ability)
effect: Mold Breaker prevents a target's ability from affecting moves that the Mold Breaker Pokémon uses. It only affects abilities that change the power, accuracy or other effects of moves. For example, a Haxorus with Mold Breaker would be able to hit a Bronzong (having Levitate) using a Ground type move like Earthquake. Ground type moves would still not affect Flying types. However, if Dragon Claw KOs a Pokémon with Aftermath, a Mold Breaker Pokémon would still lose HP as Aftermath did not affect the Dragon Claw attack itself.

name: Misty Surge (ability)
effect: Misty Surge creates a low-lying mist, like the move Misty Terrain, when the bearer enters battle. It protects all grounded Pokémon from status conditions and halves the power of Dragon type attacks.

name: Mirror Armor (ability)
effect:
Reflects any stat-lowering effects.
 No Pokémon have the ability Mirror Armor as a regular ability.

name: Minus (ability)
effect: Ups Sp. Atk if another Pokémon has Plus or Minus.

name: Mimicry (ability)
effect:
Changes type depending on the terrain.
 No Pokémon have Mimicry as a hidden ability.

name: Merciless (ability)
effect:
The Pokémon's attacks become critical hits if the target is poisoned.
 No Pokémon have Merciless as a hidden ability.

name: Mega Launcher (ability)
effect: Mega Launcher increases the power of all aura and pulse moves by 50%. Heal Pulse boosts the HP restored by 50%. The attacks classed as aura and pulse moves are shown below with their normal and boosted power: * No Pokémon with Mega Launcher can learn this move. No Pokémon have Mega Launcher as a hidden ability.

name: Marvel Scale (ability)
effect: Marvel Scale raises the ability-bearer's Defense by 50% when inflicted by a major status ailment (poison, burn, paralysis, freeze or sleep). All effects of the status condition remain, e.g. losing HP each turn (poison, burn), speed drop (paralysis) or being unable to attack (paralysis, freeze, sleep).

name: Magnet Pull (ability)
effect: Magnet Pull prevents Steel type Pokémon from switching out of battle or fleeing. If a Pokémon with Magnet Pull is the leading party Pokémon, it is 50% more likely that a wild Pokémon encountered will be Steel type. No Pokémon have Magnet Pull as a hidden ability.

name: Magma Armor (ability)
effect: Magma Armor prevents the Pokémon from becoming frozen, for example from moves like Blizzard. If a Pokémon with Magma Armor (or Flame Body) and a Pokémon Egg are amongst the party Pokémon, the number of steps required to hatch the egg are halved. No Pokémon have Magma Armor as a hidden ability.

name: Magician (ability)
effect: The Pokémon steals the held item of a Pokémon it hits with a move.

name: Magic Guard (ability)
effect: Magic Guard protects the Pokémon from indirect damage, including: It does not prevent damage from confusion, trapping moves (e.g. Bind) or Struggle. In Generation 4 a Pokémon with Magic Guard cannot be poisoned from Toxic Spikes, nor become fully immobile through paralysis (though the Speed drop still occurs).

name: Magic Bounce (ability)
effect: Reflects status- changing moves.

name: Long Reach (ability)
effect:
The Pokémon uses its moves without making contact with the target.
 No Pokémon have the ability Long Reach as a regular ability.

name: Liquid Voice (ability)
effect: Liquid Voice causes all sound-based moves used by the Pokémon to become Water type. Water type Pokémon also gain STAB from those moves. It is the signature ability of the Primarina evolution line, though other Pokémon may acquire Liquid Voice via certain abilities or moves such as Skill Swap. Attacks shown in bold can be learned by Primarina, though the others can be called via moves such as Metronome. No Pokémon have the ability Liquid Voice as a regular ability.

name: Liquid Ooze (ability)
effect:
Damages attackers using any draining move.
 No Pokémon have Liquid Ooze as a hidden ability.

name: Limber (ability)
effect: The Pokémon is protected from paralysis.

name: Lightning Rod (ability)
effect: Lightning Rod forces all single-target Electric-type moves - used by any other Pokémon on the field - to target this Pokémon, and with 100% accuracy. This includes the status move Thunder Wave. The ability is most useful in double/triple battles. When hit by the move, it deals no damage to the ability-bearer but raises its Special Attack by one stage. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. Lightning Rod will activate for an Electric-type Hidden Power, but not Electric-type Judgment. The ability is overridden by other Pokémon becoming the center of attention from the moves Follow Me or Rage Powder. In Generations 3-4, Lightning Rod did not increase Special Attack nor give immunity to Electric-type attacks. It also did not activate for Hidden Power. In Generations 3-5, this ability's name was formatted as Lightningrod.

name: Light Metal (ability)
effect: Light Metal halves the Pokémon's weight in battle. Decreasing weight affects these moves:

name: Libero (ability)
effect: Libero changes the Pokémon's type to that of its previously used attack. No Pokémon have the ability Libero as a regular ability.

name: Levitate (ability)
effect: Levitate causes the Pokémon to be raised (like Flying-type Pokémon). Raised Pokémon are not affected by Ground-type moves, Spikes, Toxic Spikes nor Arena Trap. Full details in glossary. No Pokémon have Levitate as a hidden ability.

name: Leaf Guard (ability)
effect: Leaf Guard prevents the bearer from succumbing to major status ailments (sleep, burns, poisoning, paralysis or freezing) during sunny weather. It does not prevent minor status ailments such as Confusion or Infatuation, nor does it prevent self-inflicted status conditions such as from using Rest.

name: Klutz (ability)
effect: The Pokémon can't use any held items.

name: Keen Eye (ability)
effect: Keen Eye prevents the Pokémon from losing accuracy, for example from moves like Sand-Attack. If a Pokémon with Keen Eye is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are 50% less likely to be lower level.

name: Justified (ability)
effect: Justified raises the ability-bearer's Attack by one stage when hit by a damaging Dark-type move. The Attack rises for every hit of the move Beat Up. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

name: Iron Fist (ability)
effect: Iron Fist increases the power of all punching moves by 20%. The attacks classed as punching moves are shown below with their normal and boosted power: * No Pokémon with Iron Fist can learn these moves.

name: Iron Barbs (ability)
effect: When a Pokémon with Iron Barbs is hit by a move that makes contact, the attacker receives damage equal to 1⁄8 of their maximum HP. Multi-hit moves (e.g. DoubleSlap) activate Iron Barbs for each strike. No Pokémon have Iron Barbs as a hidden ability.

name: Intrepid Sword (ability)
effect:
Boosts Attack in battle.
 No Pokémon have Intrepid Sword as a hidden ability.

name: Intimidate (ability)
effect: Intimidate lower's the Attack of all opponents by one stage when the ability-bearer switches in (including the start of a battle). Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. If a Pokémon with Intimidate is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are 50% less likely to be lower level.

name: Insomnia (ability)
effect: Insomnia prevents the ability-bearer from falling asleep, both from moves by other Pokémon like Sing, and self-inflicted sleep like Rest. If a sleeping Pokémon aquires Insomnia (e.g. from Worry Seed, it will wake up on its next turn.

name: Inner Focus (ability)
effect: Inner Focus prevents the Pokémon from flinching, for example when attacked by a move like Headbutt.

name: Innards Out (ability)
effect: When a Pokémon with Innards Out faints, it deals damage to the opponent equal to amount of damage it took on the final blow. No Pokémon have Innards Out as a hidden ability.

name: Infiltrator (ability)
effect: Infiltrator ignores the effects of Reflect, Light Screen and Safeguard. In other words, if the opponent has used Safeguard, Toxic would still badly poison them.

name: Imposter (ability)
effect:
It transforms itself into the Pokémon it is facing.
 No Pokémon have the ability Imposter as a regular ability.

name: Immunity (ability)
effect: Prevents the Pokémon from getting poisoned.

name: Illusion (ability)
effect: When a Pokémon with the Illusion ability switches into battle, it takes the form of the Pokémon in last place (6th) of the player's party. Illusion will not activate if the Pokémon in last place is the same species or is fainted. The effect is aesthetic only; Illusion does not change the Pokémon's type or moves, so for example a Fighting-type move against a Zoroark disguised as Gengar would still be super effective. Any direct attack (i.e. not entry hazards, weather conditions etc) will break the illusion. No Pokémon have Illusion as a hidden ability.

name: Illuminate (ability)
effect: Illuminate has no effect in battle. If a Pokémon with Illuminate is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are twice as likely to appear. No Pokémon have Illuminate as a hidden ability.

name: Ice Scales (ability)
effect:
Halves damage from Special moves.
 No Pokémon have the ability Ice Scales as a regular ability.

name: Ice Face (ability)
effect: Ice Face is the signature ability of Eiscue. It allows the Pokémon to take a physical attack without taking damage. After the attack, Eiscue changes to its No Ice Face form, however, it can be restored in hail. No Pokémon have Ice Face as a hidden ability.

name: Ice Body (ability)
effect: A Pokémon with Ice Body will recover 1⁄16 of its maximum HP during hail, after each turn. It also grants immunity to the hailstorm damage, if not already immune.

name: Hyper Cutter (ability)
effect: Hyper Cutter prevents the bearer's Attack stat from being lowered by other Pokémon, through moves such as Growl or abilities such as Intimidate. It does not prevent self-inflicted decreases, for example from Superpower. No Pokémon have Hyper Cutter as a hidden ability.

name: Hydration (ability)
effect: A Pokémon with Hydration will cure itself of any status conditions during rain, at the end of each turn. This includes self-inflicted conditions such as from using Rest.

name: Hustle (ability)
effect: Hustle increases the ability-bearer's Attack by 50%, however, it also reduces the Accuracy of all Physical moves by 20%. If a Pokémon with Hustle is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are 50% more likely to be higher level.

name: Hunger Switch (ability)
effect: Hunger Switch causes Morpeko to change its form each turn, alternating between Full Belly Mode and Hangry Mode. Morpeko's form also changes the type of its signature move, Aura Wheel. No Pokémon have Hunger Switch as a hidden ability.

name: Huge Power (ability)
effect: Raises the Pokémon's Attack stat.

name: Honey Gather (ability)
effect: Honey Gather has no effect in battle. When a battle ends, any party Pokémon with Honey Gather may pick up honey as a held item (if they are not already holding an item).

name: Heavy Metal (ability)
effect: Heavy Metal doubles the Pokémon's weight in battle. Increasing weight affects these moves:

name: Heatproof (ability)
effect: Heatproof reduces the damage taken from Fire-type moves by 50%. It also halves the damage from a burn, from 1⁄8 to 1⁄16 of the Pokémon's maximum HP. No Pokémon have Heatproof as a hidden ability.

name: Healer (ability)
effect: May heal an ally's status conditions.

name: Harvest (ability)
effect:
May create another Berry after one is used.
 No Pokémon have the ability Harvest as a regular ability.

name: Guts (ability)
effect: Guts raises the ability-bearer's Attack by 50% when inflicted by a major status ailment (poison, burn, paralysis, freeze or sleep). If burnt, the Pokémon does not suffer the usual drop in Attack. All other effects of the status condition remain, e.g. losing HP each turn (poison, burn), speed drop (paralysis) or being unable to attack (paralysis, freeze, sleep).

name: Gulp Missile (ability)
effect: Gulp Missile is the signature ability of Cramorant. If Cramorant uses the move Surf or Dive, it returns with a fish in its mouth. If Cramorant then takes damage, it retaliates by spitting out the fish, dealing extra damage. Cramorant may also return carrying a Pikachu. If Pikachu is launched at the opponent they will become paralyzed. No Pokémon have Gulp Missile as a hidden ability.

name: Grim Neigh (ability)
effect:
Boosts Special Attack after knocking out a Pokémon.
 No Pokémon have Grim Neigh as a hidden ability.

name: Grassy Surge (ability)
effect: Grassy Surge creates a low-lying grassy field, like the move Grassy Terrain, when the Pokémon enters battle. It restores the HP of grounded Pokémon each turn and increases the power of Grass type attacks.

name: Grass Pelt (ability)
effect:
Boosts the Defense stat in Grassy Terrain.
 No Pokémon have the ability Grass Pelt as a regular ability.

name: Gorilla Tactics (ability)
effect:
Boosts the Pokémon's Attack stat but only allows the use of the first selected move.
 No Pokémon have Gorilla Tactics as a hidden ability.

name: Gooey (ability)
effect:
Contact with the Pokémon lowers the attacker's Speed stat.
 No Pokémon have the ability Gooey as a regular ability.

name: Gluttony (ability)
effect: A Pokémon with Gluttony will use a pinch berry when its HP drops to 50%, rather than the usual 25%. Pinch berries are: Figy, Wiki, Mago, Aguav, Iapapa, Liechi, Ganlon, Salac, Petaya, Apicot, Lansat, Starf, Micle and Custap. (Their descriptions state that they work in a pinch.)

name: Galvanize (ability)
effect:
Normal-type moves become Electric-type moves and their power boosted.
 No Pokémon have the ability Galvanize as a regular ability.

name: Gale Wings (ability)
effect:
Gives priority to Flying-type moves.
 No Pokémon have the ability Gale Wings as a regular ability.

name: Fur Coat (ability)
effect: Fur Coat reduces damage taken from physical attacks by 50%. No Pokémon have Fur Coat as a hidden ability.

name: Full Metal Body (ability)
effect:
Prevents other Pokémon from lowering its stats.
 No Pokémon have Full Metal Body as a hidden ability.

name: Frisk (ability)
effect: The Pokémon can check a foe's held item.

name: Friend Guard (ability)
effect:
Reduces damage done to allies.
 No Pokémon have the ability Friend Guard as a regular ability.

name: Forewarn (ability)
effect:
Determines what moves a foe has.
 No Pokémon have Forewarn as a hidden ability.

name: Forecast (ability)
effect:
Castform transforms with the weather.
 No Pokémon have Forecast as a hidden ability.

name: Fluffy (ability)
effect: Fluffy reduces damage from contact moves by 50%, but Fire-type moves do double damage. Fire-type moves that make contact do regular damage. No Pokémon have Fluffy as a hidden ability.

name: Flower Veil (ability)
effect: Flower Veil prevents ally Grass-type Pokémon's stats from being lowered, in double and triple battles. No Pokémon have Flower Veil as a hidden ability.

name: Flower Gift (ability)
effect: Flower Gift raises the Attack and Special Defense of all party Pokémon by 50% during harsh sunlight. No Pokémon have Flower Gift as a hidden ability.

name: Flash Fire (ability)
effect: When a Pokémon with Flash Fire is hit by a Fire-type move, it does not deal damage but instead raises the power of the bearer's Fire-type moves by 50%. Subsequent hits do not raise the power even more, but the effect remains while the ability-bearer is in battle.

name: Flare Boost (ability)
effect:
Powers up special attacks when burned.
 No Pokémon have the ability Flare Boost as a regular ability.

name: Flame Body (ability)
effect: If a Pokémon with Flame Body is hit by a move that makes contact, there is a 30% chance the attacker will become burned. If a Pokémon with Flame Body (or Magma Armor) and a Pokémon Egg are both in the party Pokémon, the number of steps required to hatch the egg are halved.

name: Filter (ability)
effect: Filter reduces the damage taken from super-effective attacks by 25%. For example, a Dark-type move used against a Psychic-type Pokémon with Filter would deal 1.5× the usual damage instead of 2×. A double weakness would be reduced from 4× to 3×. No Pokémon have Filter as a hidden ability.

name: Fairy Aura (ability)
effect: Fairy Aura raises the power of Fairy-type moves by 33%, for all Pokémon on the field (not just the ability-bearer). It is the signature ability of Xerneas. No Pokémon have Fairy Aura as a hidden ability.

name: Dauntless Shield (ability)
effect:
Boosts Defense in battle.
 No Pokémon have Dauntless Shield as a hidden ability.

name: Dark Aura (ability)
effect: Dark Aura raises the power of Dark-type moves by 33% for all Pokémon on the field (not just the ability-bearer). It is the signature ability of Yveltal. No Pokémon have Dark Aura as a hidden ability.

name: Dancer (ability)
effect: When another Pokémon on the field uses any Dance move, Dancer causes the ability-bearer to use that same move immediately afterward. They will still use their own move originally selected, at the usual time (e.g. after the opponent if they are slower). Effects and status conditions apply for both the copied move and original move. For example if the Dancer Pokémon is confused, they may hurt themselves in confusion when using their move and when copying a Dance move. The moves that Dancer can copy are: No Pokémon have Dancer as a hidden ability.

name: Damp (ability)
effect: Damp prevents all Pokémon on the field from using the moves Selfdestruct and Explosion. It also prevents damage (to the Damp Pokémon only) from the ability Aftermath.

name: Cute Charm (ability)
effect: If a Pokémon with Cute Charm is hit by a move that makes contact, there is a 30% chance the attacker will become infatuated. It will not infatuate Pokémon of the same gender, genderless Pokémon, nor those with the ability Oblivious. Infatuated Pokémon have a 50% chance of being immobilized by love each turn and unable to attack. If a Pokémon with Cute Charm is the leading party Pokémon, the chance of encountering a Pokémon of the opposite gender is 2⁄3.

name: Cursed Body (ability)
effect: May disable a move used on the Pokémon.

name: Curious Medicine (ability)
effect:
Resets all stat changes upon entering battlefield.
 No Pokémon have Curious Medicine as a hidden ability.

name: Cotton Down (ability)
effect: When a Pokémon with Cotton Down is hit by an attack, it lowers the attacker's Speed. No Pokémon have Cotton Down as a hidden ability.

name: Corrosion (ability)
effect: Corrosion allows the bearer to poison any Pokémon, including Steel and Poison types. No Pokémon have Corrosion as a hidden ability.

name: Contrary (ability)
effect: Makes stat changes have an opposite effect.

name: Compound Eyes (ability)
effect: Compound Eyes raises the ability-bearer's accuracy by 30%. In Generations 3-5, this ability's name was formatted as Compoundeyes. If a Pokémon with Compound Eyes is first in the party, Pokémon that can be holding items have that chance increase from 50% to 60% (for common items), 5% to 20% (for uncommon items) or 1% to 5% (for rare items).

name: Competitive (ability)
effect: Competitive raises the ability-bearer's Special Attack by two stages when hit by a stat-lowering move. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

name: Comatose (ability)
effect: Comatose causes the Pokémon to behave as if it were asleep, though it doesn't officially have the Sleep status condition. It can still use its regular moves, but cannot be inflicted with any major status condition (sleep, poison, paralysis, burn, or freeze). Moves that target sleeping Pokémon (such as Dream Eater) work on a Pokémon with Comatose, and the ability-bearer can use the moves Sleep Talk and Snore. The power of Hex and Wake-Up Slap still doubles when targeted at a Comatose Pokémon (though Wake-Up Slap does not suppress Comatose). Comatose cannot be removed or replaced via moves like Skill Swap or the Mummy ability. The move Purify and the Chesto Berry item do not work on a Pokémon with Comatose. No Pokémon have Comatose as a hidden ability.

name: Color Change (ability)
effect: Color Change changes the ability-bearer's type, when hit by a damage dealing move, to the type of that move. For example being hit by X Scissor will change the Pokémon to Bug-type. Dual-type Pokémon change to single-types. If a Pokémon with Color Change has a Substitute, the ability does not activate. Color Change activates for the last strike of a multi-hit move. In Generations 3-4, Color Change activates on the first strike of a multi-hit move, thus subsequent hits may be not very effective. No Pokémon have Color Change as a hidden ability.

name: Cloud Nine (ability)
effect: Cloud Nine suppresses all effects brought on by weather, including move power increases, end-of-turn damage, accuracy changes, relevant abilities and so on.

name: Clear Body (ability)
effect: Prevents other Pokémon from lowering its stats.

name: Chlorophyll (ability)
effect: Chlorophyll doubles the ability-bearer's Speed during bright sunshine.

name: Chilling Neigh (ability)
effect:
Boosts Attack after knocking out a Pokémon.
 No Pokémon have Chilling Neigh as a hidden ability.

name: Cheek Pouch (ability)
effect: Cheek Pouch restores the bearer's HP when a Berry is consumed, on top of the berry's usual effects. So for example, it may cure a status condition and restore HP, or restore more HP than normal. No Pokémon have Cheek Pouch as a hidden ability.

name: Bulletproof (ability)
effect: Bulletproof makes the Pokémon immune to ball and bomb moves. In Generation 6, Rock Blast is not affected by Bulletproof.

name: Blaze (ability)
effect: Blaze increases the power of Fire-type moves by 50% (1.5×) when the ability-bearer's HP falls below a third of its maximum (known in-game as in a pinch).

name: Big Pecks (ability)
effect: Big Pecks prevents the ability-bearer's Defense stat from being lowered, for example via Tail Whip.

name: Berserk (ability)
effect: Berserk raises the Pokémon's Special Attack by one stage when its HP falls below 50%. No Pokémon have Berserk as a hidden ability.

name: Beast Boost (ability)
effect:
The Pokémon boosts its most proficient stat each time it knocks out a Pokémon.
 No Pokémon have Beast Boost as a hidden ability.

name: Battle Bond (ability)
effect: Battle Bond causes Greninja to transform into Ash-Greninja when it KOs an opponent. Battle Bond also increases the power of Greninja's signature move Water Shuriken. No Pokémon have Battle Bond as a hidden ability.

name: Battle Armor (ability)
effect: Battle Armor prevents the Pokémon from receiving a critical hit.

name: Battery (ability)
effect: Battery allows the Pokémon to raise the power of teammates' special moves. No Pokémon have Battery as a hidden ability.

name: Ball Fetch (ability)
effect: If the Pokémon is not holding an item, it will fetch the Poké Ball from the first failed throw of the battle. No Pokémon have Ball Fetch as a hidden ability.

name: Bad Dreams (ability)
effect: Bad Dreams causes all sleeping opponents to lose 1⁄8 of their maximum HP at the end of each turn. No Pokémon have Bad Dreams as a hidden ability.

name: Aura Break (ability)
effect: Aura Break cancels the effects of the abilities Fairy Aura and Dark Aura and instead reduces the power of Dark-type and Fairy-type moves by 25%, for all Pokémon on the field. Aura Break is not affected by the abilities Mold Breaker, Teravolt, or Turboblaze. Aura Break is the signature ability of Zygarde. Similarly, the abilities it reverses are also signature abilities of legendary Pokémon from Pokémon X&Y: Xerneas and Yveltal. No Pokémon have Aura Break as a hidden ability.

name: As One (ability)
effect:
Combines Unnerve and Chilling Neigh/Grim Neigh
 No Pokémon have As One as a hidden ability.

name: Aroma Veil (ability)
effect:
Protects allies from attacks that limit their move choices.
 No Pokémon have the ability Aroma Veil as a regular ability.

name: Arena Trap (ability)
effect: Arena Trap prevents opponents from fleeing or switching out. Raised Pokémon are not affected. Raised Pokémon are any Flying types or those under the effects of Levitate, Magnet Rise or Telekinesis. Full details in glossary. If a Pokémon with Arena Trap is the leading party Pokémon, wild Pokémon are twice as likely to appear. No Pokémon have Arena Trap as a hidden ability.

name: Anticipation (ability)
effect: A Pokémon with Anticipation will shudder upon entering battle, if an opponent has a move that is super-effective against it, or a One-Hit-KO move (Fissure, Horn Drill, Guillotine or Sheer Cold). It only activates when the ability-bearer switches in, not when an opponent switches in. Anticipation does not activate if the opponent has a move that varies in type, such as Hidden Power, Judgment or Weather Ball, even if those moves would be super-effective.

name: Anger Point (ability)
effect: Anger Point raises the ability-bearer's Attack to its maximum level - +6 stages or 4× usual power - when a move targeting it receives a critical hit.

name: Analytic (ability)
effect:
Boosts move power when the Pokémon moves last.
 No Pokémon have the ability Analytic as a regular ability.

name: Air Lock (ability)
effect: Air Lock suppresses all effects brought on by weather, including move power increases, end-of-turn damage, accuracy changes, relevant abilities and so on. No Pokémon have Air Lock as a hidden ability.

name: Aftermath (ability)
effect: If an attacker faints a Pokémon with Aftermath using a contact move, the attacker will lose 1⁄4 of their maximum HP.

name: Aerilate (ability)
effect: Aerilate causes all Normal-type attacking moves used by the Pokémon to become Flying-type, and increase in power by 20%. Flying-type Pokémon also gain STAB from those moves (which means an effective increase of 80%). In Generation 6, Aerilate increases affected moves' power by 30%. No Pokémon have Aerilate as a hidden ability.

name: Adaptability (ability)
effect: Adaptability increases the effectiveness of STAB moves from the usual 1.5× to 2×. For example, a Water-type Pokémon using Surf (base power 90) would normally get an effective power of 135. With Adaptability it would be 180 instead.
